intro: Potima, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with indirect light. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, blue, and white. Potima is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
